FuncDef:
The configuration exclusive command enables the configuration locking function that allows only one user to configure the system. During this period, all other users can only query configurations.
The undo configuration exclusive command disables the configuration locking function. The configuration exclusive command enables the configuration locking function that allows only one user to configure the system. During this period, all other users can only query configurations. The undo configuration exclusive command disables the configuration locking function. By default, the configuration locking function is disabled.
ExtraInfo: The current device allows multiple users to log in and perform configurations. However, if multiple users who have logged in to the device concurrently perform configurations, configuration conflicts may occur, causing service exceptions. If a user needs to exclusively perform configurations, you can run the configuration exclusive command to lock the system configuration. You can run the display configuration exclusive user command to query information about the user who locks the configuration set.
